channel.title: Life on 2D Steve
channel.description: Recent content in Life on 2D Steve

item.title: Dragon Con Pro
item.description: I’m currently in an overwhelming state of gratefulness. Ash and I were able to accomplish something we were unsure would ever happen.

item.title: Uh, Live
item.description: Dreams come true, man. Sometimes it takes a while. Sometimes it happens in a flash.

item.title: Enema of the State - 20th Anniversary
item.description: Back in 1999, I was a fourteen year old kid still listening mostly to stuff his parents liked and occasionally venturing into classic rock.

item.title: The 30 Day Challenge
item.description: I alluded to participating in a 30 day challenge in my last post, and I promised to write another blog post about it.

item.title: Well, Hello There, 2019
item.description: “It’s the new year! Time for a new me!” - Tons of people everywhere

item.title: Hamilton
item.description: I saw Hamilton last night and it lived up to all the hype.

item.title: Empathy
item.description: I have always been a magnet for feelings. If I see someone crying, there’s a good chance I’m going to cry.

item.title: Potty Mouth
item.description: The rise of the Twitch superstar has been an interesting one.

item.title: Building Myself
item.description: Over the last couple of years, I have spent more time reading non-fiction works than I think I have in my life.

item.title: Level 33
item.description: I am officially level 33! I have earned enough experience to get myself to the next great step on the way to taking a permanent dirt nap.

item.title: My Wife Loves Me Pt 2
item.description: Last week, I wrote a post about how my wife loves me by hating me just enough to get me into the gym.

item.title: Here We Go Again
item.description: A while back I posted some stuff about how I was eating healthy and my life was going to change for the better.

item.title: My Wife Loves Me
item.description: My wife is an amazing human being. I would not be nearly the person I am without her by my side.

item.title: A Fresh Coat of Paint
item.description: Itâ€™s time. I finally moved this blog to some place that is a better example of who I am today than who I was in 2004 when I started it.

item.title: My Phone is Boring
item.description: I love my iPhone. I do. It’s a thing that keeps me in touch with people, gives me cool stuff to look at when I’m standing in line, or more likely sitting on the toilet.

item.title: Blackout
item.description: A few weeks ago, I decided to significantly reduce my time on social media.

item.title: Six Pounds
item.description: I did it! I stepped on the scale yesterday and I’m down six pounds in a week.

item.title: Eat Right
item.description: Over the past week, Stephanie and I have both rededicated ourselves to eating better.

item.title: Rocketbook
item.description: My friend Chris got me the snazziest notebook for Christmas, and after a couple weeks with it, I am LOVING it.

item.title: Building Community
item.description: For ten solid years we have attempted to grow a community around Horseshoes & Hand Grenades.

item.title: Do Something
item.description: I’m a huge fan of The Art of Manliness website. I don’t always swing in and read it but I do get the weekly digests, and every now and then I’ll search the website for something that I’m curious about.

item.title: Just Dad Things
item.description: Being a dad is a magical thing. You never truly feel rested from anything but at the same time you find some kind of strange energy that keeps you moving and enjoying everything.

item.title: Trying Something New
item.description: I’m considering a complete departure from social media, but without some sort of outlet in the form of the written word, I’m not sure I’ll be able to handle the escape.

item.title: Dragon Con 2017
item.description: Every time we come to this convention, we have a good time.

item.title: Introspective Stephen
item.description: This blog has been neglected, then un-neglected, then neglected again for years.

item.title: Europe Bound!
item.description: I’m on my first ever trip across the Atlantic Ocean. I’m headed to the Czech Republic for work and I’m both excited and super nervous about the whole ordeal.

item.title: Streaming!
item.description: I have a had a blast picking up the hobby of streaming video games online.

item.title: The Bottom of the Barrel
item.description: It’s been a couple days since the infamous night that Trump managed to take the election.

item.title: In Shock - Election 2016
item.description: I don’t really know what to think this morning. It’s the day after the election in the US and we’re staring down the barrel of a Trump presidency.

item.title: Wounded Knee
item.description: I haven’t posted anything to this blog in a really long time.

item.title: State of the Stephen - 2015
item.description: Hello, blog! Long time, no see. I have no idea what to write or what to say or what to talk about in this blog post.

item.title: Fatherhood
item.description: WOW. This will be the first of many posts in which I try to pull together the wave of emotions that fall over you when you become a dad.

item.title: Samuel Parker Adams
item.description: My first child is coming into the world tomorrow. Writing that sentence is nuts.

item.title: Introspective
item.description: Almost every six months or so I find myself in a weird introspective phase.

item.title: Manvotionals
item.description: I picked up a book the other day called “Manvotionals” by Brett & Kate McKay.
Well, last year went by fast! You didn’t even get to check out any of it!
It’s a new year…again. Congratulations to everyone for surviving another revolution around our big, fat, glowing star.

item.title: Back Porch Coffee
item.description: I’m sitting on my back porch right now, just hanging out and really enjoying the warm weather.

item.title: Routines
item.description: Over the past few months, it’s been my goal to become more fit, eat healthier, study more, learn things, and just be a generally all around better person in a lot of different ways.

item.title: Some Are More Sick Than Others
item.description: It’s been a while since I’ve written in the good ol' blog here, but there’s no way I’m going to let it go as long as I did before!

item.title: Lights and Ladders
item.description: I got to wake up at the crack of dawn this morning to go help setup the church this morning and once again had a really good time.

item.title: Laptops and Guns
item.description: This weekend has been really good for me so far! I’ve been able to do some pretty fun things and at least one “first” for me.

item.title: Dated
item.description: Today, Stephanie and I finally got a chance to go on a bit of a date.

item.title: The Wise Man's Fear
item.description: I finally picked up the second book in Patrick Rothfuss' Kingkiller Chronicle trilogy.

item.title: Church Folk
item.description: Today was an absolutely fantastic day! I’m super tired, mentally exhausted, and I’m having trouble putting sentences together, but that is all because I’m just running low on sleep.

item.title: Exhaustion
item.description: I’ve been getting up at 6:00am every morning this week in an attempt to give myself more time to eat a solid breakfast, read a bit of the Bible, and just have a more leisurely morning in general.

item.title: Back on Track
item.description: For the first time in years, I am below 200 pounds!

item.title: Ninety Days
item.description: Well, it looks like if I can survive the weekend I have made it through the first ninety days of my new job!

item.title: That Felt Good
item.description: Tonight was the epic return of Horseshoes & Hand Grenades. We rode into the internet on tigers and showed the world what real fun felt like.

item.title: What Is Everybody Yelling About?!
item.description: I am as bothered by the new Funeral for a Friend album, _Conduit, _as I am excited about the Tegan and Sara album that just came out.

item.title: I Had No Idea...
item.description: I was sitting here struggling with what to come up with to write about tonight when I went my old faithful museâ€¦Reddit.

item.title: Love Them Where They Are
item.description: I need to write something about how much I appreciate the church that Stephanie and I found when we moved down here.

item.title: Sim City
item.description: I got into the beta to the newest edition of Sim City!

item.title: The Name of the Wind
item.description: I listened to a guy on a podcast today talking about how he blogged every single day.

item.title: High Fiber
item.description: I was sitting around editing together another little masterpiece to herald H&H’s triumphant return, then I remembered, it’s blog time!

item.title: Virginia is for Suckers Pt 1
item.description: I promised a story about the mess that happened to us in VA on Saturday, and I’m going to make good on that promise right now.

item.title: Two of My Favorite People
item.description: I missed blogging yesterday, but I’m going to have a whole post about why that happened.

item.title: Good Friends
item.description: Had an amazing time with our good friends, Peyton and Josh.

item.title: The White Rabbit
item.description: I was so stupid late for work this morning. I woke up a full 30 minutes AFTER I should have been there.

item.title: I'm a Robot
item.description: The newest old Weezer album is amazing and I wish I had picked it up before.

item.title: Burritos and Budgets
item.description: WOW, my shoulders, back, arms, and chest are absolutely killing me today!

item.title: Back in the Saddle
item.description: I feel like I may die. Okay, that was a bit dramatic, but I think it’s accurate.

item.title: Nooooooooooooooo
item.description: To get the real raw emotion out of the subject line of this post, it’s almost critical that you visit the website below: www.

item.title: Writer's Block
item.description: Every night I sit down here at the desk and wonder what in the world I’m going to write about today.

item.title: Templates and Tantrums
item.description: I have a tendency to flip out when I do things multiple times and it doesn’t work out.

item.title: Holy Crap, It's Midnight!
item.description: That’s what Stephy just said mere moments ago from the kitchen.

item.title: I'm am Vengeance, I am the Night, I am Batman!
item.description: Ashley, Steph, and I have spent the last few hours watching Batman: The Animated Series, and I am having an absolute blast with it.

item.title: Raspberries
item.description: This whole “posting every day” thing is going to really force me to come up with some content so I feel like it’s even worth writing a post.

item.title: Friday, Friday, Gonna Get Down on Friday
item.description: Someone kill me for getting that song stuck in my head.

item.title: Down with the Sickness
item.description: I have a cold. This is poop. Aside from my ailments, I’m doing pretty good this 3rd day of our brand new year.

item.title: New Year's Creed
item.description: I decided that this year I would try to spend a bit more time blogging about stuff, or just writing in general.

item.title: 2012 - Apocalypse Not
item.description: I’m typing this blog post on my new Razer Black Widow Ultimate which may be the loudest keyboard in the universe, but it’s glorious to type on.

item.title: Remembering Randy Warden
item.description: Yesterday, I woke up and looked at Facebook. Of course it’s the first thing I do when I wake up, which is ridiculous and a habit I need to break.

item.title: Purpose
item.description: I’ve spent the last couple weeks thinking about what I can do with an older podcast idea to revive it and make it into something people would want to listen to.

item.title: Study Buddy
item.description: I never learned how to study anything. I somehow managed to make it all the way through high school and college with no study skills whatsoever.

item.title: Nerd
item.description: Every time I visit my blog I find myself disappointed that I’m still using this crappy default theme.

item.title: Project Blue Devil
item.description: A TON of things have happened since my last post here.

item.title: Changes
item.description: I learned in the last week that my best friend in the world is moving 3000 miles away to Seattle, WA.

item.title: I Made A List
item.description: I made a list of stuff I want to accomplish. It’s not a full list of everything that I EVER want to accomplish, but it’s a start.

item.title: Preservation
item.description: It’s almost embarrassing that I haven’t written in this blog since June of last year.

item.title: First Anniversary: Gatlinburg, TN
item.description: “Holy crap, this is awesome!” That’s pretty much what I said when I walked into mine and Steph’s cabin in the Smokies for our first annniversary.

item.title: Mortality
item.description: Growing up I’ve never really had a whole lot of issues with anything as far as health is concerned.

item.title: It's 1/1/11!!11!
item.description: This is my first post of the new year, 2011. It’s a whole lot like the last post I had from 2010, in that it contains text.

item.title: National Novel Writing Fail
item.description: Another year goes by and I’ve got no novel to speak of.

item.title: Jibber Jabber
item.description: I’m just sitting around waiting for Steph to call so I figured I would write a thing or two in this here weblog.

item.title: 5000 Meters
item.description: Aha! The blog is still here with just a little dust sprinkled on the cover.

item.title: Learnin' Me Some Cisco
item.description: I arrived in our nation’s capital for the second time in my life today so that I can go get trained on switches and routers.

item.title: Life Modification
item.description: I started running. YES! You heard me right. I have spent the years since gym class NOT running for any reason whatsoever, except for an occasional game of spotlight, or running from a ruthless animal out for my blood.

item.title: New-ness
item.description: Hey everybody! It’s been a long time since I’ve typed anything but to be honest, it’s been such a whirlwind couple months that I just didn’t have the time.

item.title: Quarter of a Century
item.description: As of today, I have officially spent 1 quarter of a century on Earth.

item.title: Our Nation's Capital
item.description: Hey everybody! My name is Stephen and I fail miserably at keeping this blog going for long periods of time.

item.title: Reinvention
item.description: Every now and then you just have to do something different.

item.title: Winter Can Bite Me
item.description: It’s been a long, hard, harsh Winter and I think I’m ready for it to die in a fire.

item.title: In Desperate Need of Vitamin D, But This Will Have To Do
item.description: There has been a significant lack of sunshine in the Northeast part of the US for the past MONTH, and I am definitely needing some valuable vitamin D.

item.title: Broken Addiction
item.description: I am happy to say that for the last 3 months I have been completely World of Warcraft free!

item.title: Tony Horton is Evil
item.description: For those of you scratching your noggins over who the heck I’m talking about, he is the evil mastermind for the P90X program.

item.title: Save the Date!
item.description: Today has been a whole lot less eventful than I expected.

item.title: What the Crap!?
item.description: I haven’t posted since October!? What in the world is wrong with me!

item.title: Hangin' In Nawlins - Part 3
item.description: So it’s been a couple weeks since we actually returned from Nawlins, but I wanted to at least post a little about our tripÂ becauseÂ we had so much fun!

item.title: Hangin' in Nawlins Part 2
item.description: Here I am to continue my story from yesterday. I’m sure I’ll eventually get to the part where we hang out in Nawlins and I tell you what we did, but for now we’ll just finish up the trip on the airplane.

item.title: Hangin' in Nawlins
item.description: Steph and I have officially made it to New Orleans, Louisiana!

item.title: Plans
item.description: Today it has officially begun! Stephanie and I have booked the wedding planner that is going to carry us through until we say our vows and walk away from the altar as Mr.

item.title: All Natural
item.description: I decided that today was another day that it would be necessary to blog, but throughout the day nothing of interest really happened that I deemed blogworthy.

item.title: Sick @ Home
item.description: I can’t stand missing work. As much as I like being at home, I do NOT like being at home on days when I am supposed to be working.

item.title: Big Gaps Are No Fun
item.description: I cannot believe that I haven’t sat down to type in this blog for over 4 months!

item.title: History is Made
item.description: Today is a fantastic day in the history of our country.

item.title: Going Home!
item.description: Today is the day that we head back down this mountain and back to good ol' Morgantown!

item.title: When You Wanna Go Wee!
item.description: As I sit and write this blog post almost every part of my body is in pain.

item.title: The Journey Begins...
item.description: The above video was filmed with my sweet little Flip MinoHD, so please forgive some of the shakiness.

item.title: Cold Turkey
item.description: I decided as of last Friday that I was done with soda.

item.title: Snow Hat
item.description: I bought this snow hat the other day! It’s awesome, and completely ridiculous!

item.title: 400th Post!
item.description: This is my four hundredth post since starting this blog in September of 2004.

item.title: Last Day With Lando
item.description: My best friend Landon is making a great trek tomorrow across the ocean to the land of Thai, otherwise known as Thailand.

item.title: Anti-Monkey Butt Powder
item.description: I’m very upset that I haven’t had a whole lot of time to write this week, but my flight was all jacked up on Sunday night.

item.title: I So Envy Superman
item.description: I had to fly today, and I’ve decided that it’s just way too inconvenient to have to use a machine to do it.

item.title: Like the Seal Song Goes
item.description: I am finding it so very hard to get motivated to clean up.

item.title: Minimalist
item.description: I’m sitting at Stephanie’s desk right now typing up this blog post and I’m starting to really dig it.

item.title: Inconceivable!
item.description: I really canNOT believe that it has been so long since I’ve written in my blog.

item.title: Changes
item.description: These last couple months have been incredible! I can’t even begin to tell you guys how awesome it is to have a normal relationship with my fiance, instead of the long distance, never see each other crap that we have dealth with for the past 5 years.

item.title: The Last Day of Work
item.description: Well, it’s official! I just completed my last day of work as an employee of the Florida Department of Corrections.

item.title: Thoughts on Moving
item.description: Man, it has been way too long since I’ve written. I think I’m going to just go ahead and start every post like that.

item.title: Memorial Day!
item.description: I have had probably the most uneventful Memorial Day weekend of my entire life, but at the same time a few really cool things did happen.

item.title: The Great Disaster
item.description: I find myself in a very inconvenient spot right now, and that is a spot without any internet whatsoever.

item.title: Commitment
item.description: It’s been a long time since I’ve written anything of any kind in this blog and for that, I apologize.

item.title: Writing Bugs
item.description: I’ve got the writing bug again, although I have to admit that it’s not exactly for this blog.

item.title: Bad News...Twice!
item.description: This week has been particularly devastating for geeks everywhere. Gary Gygax, creator of the tabletop role-playing adventure game Dungeons and Dragons, has died.

item.title: Home Movies!
item.description: Yesterday I finally finished going through all the home movies that I have, and I actually found a few things that I had forgotten that I recorded.

item.title: Like A Cowboy
item.description: I finally rode horses again the other day after years of not riding.

item.title: 30 Days
item.description: I have embarked on an adventure that may very well leave me wishing I was dead.

item.title: Possibilities
item.description: I really need to put a stop to this once a month posting crap that I’m doing.

item.title: Obsessive
item.description: Brace yourselves, ye faithful visitors. I have a crapload of things to say because I’m in one of those rare moods to write.

item.title: Turkey and Ham
item.description: I can’t believe I missed an entire month of blogging :(.

item.title: Stupid People Bug Me
item.description: So an interesting little tidbit popped up in the news the other day and has forced the crazy folk out into the wild again with their stupid theories and ridiculous assumptions.

item.title: Challenges
item.description: Man, I need to do a much better job of keeping this blog up-to-date with the goings on in my life.

item.title: Patience
item.description: I’m having a hard time waiting on these people from Morgantown to call me.

item.title: Even If It Kills Me
item.description: I’ve been doing a whole lot of stuff the last couple weeks, and I feel like I’m finally getting somewhere.

item.title: The Quest
item.description: I feel that I am about to embark on a ridiculously long journey to an unknown land.

item.title: Prophetic Dream
item.description: I had this crazy prophetic dream last night. You know those dreams where you’re in the future and you get to see all the things that might happen to you.

item.title: Post Secret
item.description: I remember a few years ago when I stumbled upon this site and thought to myself, “What an awesome idea!

item.title: Scaring Myself
item.description: I feel like I’ve been doing a crapload of work on Pi and CHiPS lately.

item.title: New Job
item.description: Hey Everybody! I started my new job on friday and so far it’s pretty cool.

item.title: I'm selling a Powerbook!
item.description: Hey Everybody! I just wanted to make a quick post so that you guys could have first dibs on a pretty snazzy laptop.

item.title: Hats, Macs, and More!
item.description: I know, I know, I’ve failed miserably at keeping this blog up to date and actually writing what’s going on in my life and news.

item.title: Yar matey, I be headed for the carribean!
item.description: I said to myself this morning, “Self, you should write in your blog because you’re going to be gone for a week,” to which I responded, “You’re right!

item.title: Parties Galore!
item.description: I really need to get better at this whole blogging thing.
